data.title: Now that's Italian
data.text:
Pizza is so popular now and trying to decide where to go in Folsom is truly a tough decision. We live in Folsom and have eaten in all the pizza places in Folsom. Note: My wife loves everything about it.
There is a big name pizza place across the street that we have tried and can't hold a candle to PC. We also tried another newer big busy pizza place on Blue Ravine, never again. The cold pizza was terrible the next day!
PC Pizzas always taste incredible. The sauces and toppings are tasty, plentiful and fresh. The salads are full of produce and served in large family style bowls. The service is fast and always friendly. We only bring friends to this business because it is ALWAYS a wonderful experience. The seating is designed for large and small groups and always feels family friendly. The prices can't be compared to the total enjoyment, service and fun in this wonderful place.
Sincerely,
George Starkey

data.title: Good pizza!
data.text: The place is really neat and clean, the staff is very friendly. It was our first time here, so we just took our waiter's suggestion and ordered their most popular pizza - Classico Supreme. He said it's a good combination of meat and veggies, and I totally agree with him. Tasted great! For 2 of us, we ordered a small sized pizza and I'm glad we didn't order anything bigger. I loved that their pizza comes with A LOT of toppings on it - doesn't taste like a plain bread with a little bit on something on it. Will definitely come back again to try out their other pizzas!

data.title: Best in town
data.text: The quality is always top notch. The sauce is better that any other local pizza restaurant.  They hand toss every crust and  use only the freshest toppings. Mmmm good

data.title: Pizza and Pokemon Go
data.text: What a nice lunch, with outdoor seating near a Pokestop. Add a lure, eat yummy food and catch Pokemon. The garlic chips and salad made a fine lunch choice.

data.title: Alright place
data.text:
My husband and I were visiting Folsom for the day. We had intended on eating an early dinner at Samuel Horne's Tavern, but it was totally packed and we didn't want to wait. We checked Tripadvisor for ratings on this place and since they were pretty good decided to check it out. There was no wait for a table, so that was a plus. Our waitress was very friendly, but took a little long to get our drinks to us. She was very apologetic about it, though. She recommended (and the menu recommended) their garlic chips as an appetizer. The name is pretty misleading...it's garlic bread. It was pretty tasty. 

We shared a deep dish Hawaiian style pizza. I really appreciate that they offer Macadamia nuts as a pizza topping. I love, love, love those on pizza. The pizza was fine. I did not love the sauce, though. It tasted a little odd to me, but it might just be a type of seasoning that isn't usually used in pizza sauce. 

Overall, the restaurant was fine. It definitely could use some updating. It had an old vibe to it.

data.title: Best Pizza, Great Service!
data.text: Wow! Our first night in Folsom and my husband and I were tired from travelling. We wanted a simple quick meal before resting for the night and oh boy was this a lucky find. I have to explain I usually eat a couple of slices of pizza at any restaurant as pizza isn't my "thing". Scratch that comment because it is now. We both agreed this is the best pizza we have eaten for years. The dough was perfect and toppings superb. Fresh, hot and delicious. Add to that the warm welcome and great service making this pizza restaurant a winner. I even tried the root beer float. Love the place. Try it!

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: We ordered and then picked up and ate at home. Good pizza at a good price! I've eaten here about a year ago and it was good then, too!

data.title: Might be the best pizza I've ever had!
data.text:
The family and I went with some friends to this quaint little place in old town Folsom. I had never heard of it. It is right at lunch time, but there is plenty of seating. We had a large group of 10 (6 adults, 4 kids), but they were able to seat us right away. 

The garlic chips, offered as an appetizer, as simply amazing! You could easily make a whole meal just off these. We got a standard cheese and a cheesy pesto, and they were both amazing. Even the kids went nuts over these things. Think of it as the garlic cheese bread you always get from traditional pizza places, expect these are actually good. By the time I remembered to get a photo of the garlic chips, they were already gone. I highly recommend getting these on every visit.

We had a hard time deciding on what to get, so we each got the small personal pizza size, which was plenty big enough with six slices. The kids got a small cheese pizza to share, which was eight slices, and that was a perfect size as well.

I got a pizza called the Belly Bomber. It was to-die for. Once it was all devoured, I wanted more. I wish I had ordered a standard small so I could take some home and have it the next day. It was simply dynamite. If you've never been to this little place in the heart of Folsom, you don't know what you're missing. 

It's right across the street from Chicago Fire, so I'm not sure how the competition is treating them, but it seems like they've been there a long time. The parking is a little tricky as the few blocks surrounding Sutter Street has limited parking. You may have to walk a few blocks after finding a place. But it is totally worth it. It's too bad that his location is so far from me in Elk Grove, but when I don't mind a drive, I'll definitely go out there for the best pizza ever.

data.title: Best Pizza in Folsom
data.text: My favorite pizza place - hands down.  I LOVE pizza and I would choose Pizzeria Classico over Chicago Fire, Round Table, anything any day.  Their sauce and crust is delicious and satisfying and the toppings are fresh and plentiful.  The garlic chips are a favorite for my son (and husband).  We love to get the BBQ chicken pizza and the vegetarian pizza with artichoke hearts...but I like it all.  Kids can also get their own pies.

data.title: Garlic Chips, YES
data.text: Great pizza and if you like garlic, definitely have the garlic chips.  Salads are great too.  We sometimes just have a salad and garlic chips with a glass of wine and we're full.  I've also had the spaghetti and was a little nervous about ordering it, but it was great. Had enough to bring some home.  Small and large tables for groups.  Service is great.  GO HERE

data.title: BBQ Chicken Pizza
data.text: My favorite pizza is the BBQ chicken at Pizzeria Classico.  Parking can be a challenge but it is worth it.  This thin crust pizza is perfect without being too filing.  Salads are great too.

data.title: Good pick in Old Town Folsom
data.text: The Stromboli pizza is delicious. But we usually like to split the salad that has apple and nuts (it's filling) and have pesto or garlic chips with it. Sooooo good. The pesto and garlic "chips" are really thin pizza dough. Now that I've reminded myself, guess where we're going tonight!  Plus if you're a tourist, the location is on the shopping street and they have parking in the back. Have a marghetta upstairs on the deck at the Hacienda  first!

data.title: Great pizza and salads!
data.text: Went on a Saturday night and was lucky enough to get right in with a group of 8. We had garlic chips and said to start. Suoer fresh salad and delicious dressings. Pizzas were spot on and huge. Server was fantastic and kept things full. Will absolutely be back!

data.title: If you want quality pizza, this is the place!
data.text: The family typically visits Pizzeria Classico a few times a year.  It's a bit spendy when compared to chain pizza establishments, the parking can be a pain, and if crowded you could could be in for a wait.  But the service and food are always excellent.  The salads are big enough to share, the garlic chips, calzones and pizza are stacked with toppings and always flavorful.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Dinner in Sutter area
data.text:
Had the Rosemary Chicken and Potato, Ciao, Pepperoni and Sausage/Mushroom/Pepperoni Calzone.

All were good, but our favorites were the Ciao and Calzone.

Good place to eat in the area since we had our dog.

data.title: A Folsom Tradition
data.text: We first went to Pizzeria Classico when it was located near Tahoe City, California back in the late 80's.  They opened their Folsom location several years later with the same menu and same outstanding salads and pizzas.  Their toppings are excellent and their crust is one of the best I have had.  They have a family special with salad, garlic chips and a pizza for around $40 which is a great deal.  We highly recommend the garlic or pesto chips and my family loves the creamy pesto salad dressing.  One of my favorite pizza places anywhere.

data.title: A favorite of mine.
data.text: A great Italian prepared cuisine.  A variety of choice, from appitizers, salads, pizzas and entree.  A salad and a pizza shared with others is sufficient to satisfy a hungry person.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: This is a what you see is what you get place - great pizza but also some great salads and be sure to try the garlic chips.

data.title: Best Pizza In Three Counties
data.text: If you are looking for a great pizza, beer, and a salad you cannot go wrong here.  It is a little pricy but the pizza are loaded with all the stuff you like to eat.  Also, try the garlic chips.

data.title: Pizza is alright but ambiance is dated
data.text: This place has decent pizza but it feels like a 70's pizza joint. It is a good place to go with kids but the price is high for what you get. They have a similar price point (maybe a bit cheaper) than Chicago Fire (across the street). Old Town Folsom has had several great restaurants open up recently that I feel this pizza joint will soon need to up it's curb appeal and decor to stay in business.
